definition: to go steady and strike hard (in fighting)/fig. steadily and surely
settled/steady/stable
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)

sentences.english: Hingis stayed steady throughout, never letting Kournikova break away.
sentences.chinese: 辛吉斯始终稳扎稳打，没有给库尔尼科娃以可乘之机。

sentences.english: Treat it gently by allowing your equity to grow steadily rather than in bursts.
sentences.chinese: 与其暴赢，不如缓进，稳扎稳打地积累资产。

to advance prematurely

one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable

to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
